means: 引人注目的，令人瞩目的

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均有"显著的，引人注意的"之意。
means: outstanding ： 通常指与同行或同类的人相比显得优秀或杰出，或具有他人或别的事物所没有的特征。
noticeable ： 指所描绘的事物引人注意。
remarkable ： 通常指因有与众不同的特点或优越性而引起人们注意或称道。
conspicuous ： 通常指因成绩卓著，而引人注意，或指因外观奇特、花哨或言行举止不合常规而令人注意。
striking ： 侧重能给观察者产生强烈而深刻印象。

sentence.Network_en: There's also been a noticeable rise in the political temperature.
sentence.Network_cn: 政治气氛也明显升温了。

sentence.Network_en: The carpet of leaves in my yard became more and more noticeable.
sentence.Network_cn: 我的院子里的落叶越来越厚。

sentence.Network_en: Many people in Minnesota and Tennessee have noticeable regional accents.
sentence.Network_cn: 明尼苏达州和田纳西州的许多人都有明显的地区口音。

entry.tran: 容易注意到的;显著的;明显的
entry.def: Something that is noticeable is very obvious, so that it is easy to see, hear, or recognize.

example.ex: It is noticeable that women do not have the rivalry that men have...
example.tran: 显而易见，女性不像男人们那样好勇斗狠。

example.ex: The most noticeable effect of these changes is in the way people are now working together.
example.tran: 这些变化带来的最明显效果体现在人们现在一起工作的方式上。

means.word_mean: 1. capable or worthy of drawing attention;

sentences.sentence: "after a noticeable pause the lecturer continued"
"the obtrusive behavior of a spoiled child"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 显而易见的, 值得注意的
stems_affixes.word_buile: notice注意到,注意+able……的→adj.显而易见的, 值得注意的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 臭名昭著的,声名狼藉的
stems_affixes.word_buile: not知道,注意,注释+orious多……的→多惹人注意的→臭名昭著的
notorious[[adj.臭名昭著的,声名狼藉的]]→n.臭名昭彰
denote[v.指示,表示,意味着]+ation表名词→n.指示

stems_affixes.value_cn: 值得注意的,显著的,著名的
stems_affixes.word_buile: not知道,注意,注释+able能……的→n.值得注意的,显著的,著名的
not知道,注意,注释+e→n.笔记；注释 v.注意到
note笔记+book→n.笔记簿, 笔记本

stems_affixes.value_cn: 通知,通告,布告;注意,认识
stems_affixes.word_buile: not知道,注意,注释+ice表名词→n.通知,通告,布告;注意,认识 v.注意到,注意

stems_affixes.value_cn: 概念,想法,意念,看法,观点
stems_affixes.word_buile: not知道,注意,注释+ion表名词→n.概念,想法,意念,看法,观点
de加强+not知道,注意,注释+e→指示
not知道,注意,注释+e→n.笔记；注释 v.注意到
not知道,注意,注释+ify表动词→给以注意→通知
not知道,注意,注释+ice表名词→n.通知,通告,布告;注意,认识 v.注意到,注意

Sentence.sentence: Size isn't everything, but it does matter, and the past decade has seen a noticeable counter trend toward smaller schools.

And most noticeable of all, there is the phenomenon of large urban and suburban high schools that have split up into smaller units of a few hundred, generally housed in the same grounds that once boasted thousands of students all marching to the same band.
What is most noticeable about the current trend in high school education?

means.word_mean: 显而易见的, 明显的, 显著的

sentences.en: There's been a noticeable improvement in his handwriting.
sentences.cn: 他的书法有了明显的进步。

sentences.en: The damage to my car is hardly noticeable.
sentences.cn: 我的汽车被损坏的地方不大明显。

jushi.english: There's a noticeable difference in our totals.
jushi.chinese: 我们的总数有明显的不同。

jushi.english: There's been a noticeable improvement in his handwriting.
jushi.chinese: 他的书法有了明显的进步。

jushi.english: The damage to my car is hardly noticeable.
jushi.chinese: 我的汽车被损坏的地方不大明显。
